title: EasyJet passenger tasered over luggage demands
text:
Save 
An easyJet passenger was tasered by police this morning at London’s Gatwick Airport. 
The man was reportedly “dragged off the flight”, after allegedly demanding two piece of carry-on luggage. Other passengers were also then removed from the plane, CityAM said. 
EasyJet confirmed that police boarded flight EZY831, bound for Belfast, this morning due to “a passenger behaving disruptively”. 
“While such incidents are rare, we take them very seriously [and] do not tolerate abusive or threatening behaviour onboard, and always push for prosecution,” the airline tweeted this morning. 
“The safety of passengers and crew is always EasyJet’s priority.” 
Sussex Police said in a statement: “A man is in police custody after being tasered on an aircraft waiting to depart from Gatwick Airport to Belfast on Thursday morning. 
“Police officers were called to the EasyJet flight shortly after 8am to reports of a passenger who was becoming increasingly abusive following a dispute over luggage. 
“A man has been arrested on suspicion of breach of the peace. The aircraft has been disembarked and police are taking statements from witnesses among the crew and passengers.”e Readers' comments (3) Anonymous | Thu, 20 Aug 2015 12:20 pm

Surely if the person had excess bags, this should have been dealt with before boarding, far easier to deal with the problem at the gate than in the confines of a plane? If he was allowed to board, I can see why he would think he could take two bags, tasering does seem somewhat excessive and potentially very dangerous in the confines of a packed plane Unsuitable or offensive?
